title: Bengaluru max temperature drops to 24.3°C, coldest day in May in 10 years - The News Minute
content:
1. Bengaluru max temperature drops to 24.3°C, coldest day in May in 10 years  The News Minute
  2. Cyclone Asani Brings Heavy Rain To Andhra Pradesh  NDTV
  3. Cyclone Asani Dissipates After Drenching and Cooling East, South India; No Deaths Reported So Far | The Weather Channel - Articles from The Weather Channel | weather.com  The Weather Channel
  4. Asani Cyclone LIVE Tracking Updates: Cyclone weakens in coastal Andhra, low showers expected in coastal Odisha  Times of India
  5. View Full coverage on Google News
description: As parts of south India reel under the effects of Cyclone Asani, Bengaluru also has been seeing cloudy skies and rains over the past few days. As a result, mercury levels have dropped, prompting residents in the city to dig out their winter wear. According to weather bloggers, Wednesday, May 11, was among the coldest days the city has seen in the past few years. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) confirmed this, adding that the chilly weather is a result of the cyclone which made landfall on the Andhra Pradesh coast late on Wednesday.
